sectr: Public Administration, Law, and Justice,Transportation,Health and other social services

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Railways
            Restructuring Project for Zambia was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Lessons learned from the
            project: Concession bid process should be designed so as to
            avoid protracted negotiations. The Project should cover all
            aspects of the concession and restructuring process. Every
            aspect of the proposed Concession Agreement should be fully
            discussed with all relevant arms of Government and
            stakeholders. The Bank should stay involved for at least two
            years after the concession has become operational. Vigorous
            social mitigation measures can adjust the adverse impact of retrenchment.
